label: Description
value: Button depicting scene with five figures. Two men wear white clothing and pink turbans and are training with wooden sticks, looking at their left [proper]. Behind them, a woman in a skirt, shirt and white turban also faces the same direction. On each side, two shirtless men stand wearing pants and turbans.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint on tin verre fixé, ivory (backing), glass, gilt metal

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 1 x 3.7 cm (3/8 x 1 7/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: c. 1802: Toussaint L'Ouverture, upon return to France from Haiti and Santo Domingo gives jacket with these buttons to servant boy [1]; acquired by boy's heirs in the Sedan; Professor Lalongt, College of Sedan acquires from heirs [2]; sold to Etienne Accary; 1939: sold on behalf of Accary by Salle Drouot auction house, Paris [3]; 1949: gift to Museum from the estate of Mrs. Noyes.           [1] Given to servant boy for his loyal service to Toussaint L'Ouverture  in the prison in Besancon, France from his capture in Haiti to his death in Besancon in 1813 [2] Letter from Jean Milare tells story of servant boy and Toussaint [3] Buttons arrive, possibly as a loan, at Cooper Union Museum around 1942

label: Credit line
value: Gift of R. Keith Kane from the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes

label: Description
value: Button depicting scene of figures in a landscape with a building. A shirtless man wearing a red turban and white pants fighting with a wooden stick with another man wearing white pants and striped turban as he looks to a woman who is facing both men. She wears a striped red and white scarf around her neck, orange and white skirt.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint on tin verre fixé, ivory (backing), glass, gilt metal

label: Description
value: Button depicting scene of four figures in a landscape. A woman on the left wears a striped shirt and scarf, an orange and white skirt and turban; she faces man who is dancing (marching?) and wears a white shirt with pink sash and red and white scarf on head. Two smaller figures stand to the side watching.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint on tin verre fixé, ivory (backing), glass, gilt metal

label: Description
value: Button depicting scene of five figures outside near a large house. From left: a seated man, wearing a pink shirt, playing a drum, a woman with only head visible standing behind another woman, wear white with pink stripes, who claps [to the music]. In the foreground, a lighter skinned woman wearing an open corset and skirt dances with a man who wears white clothing and a pink sash.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint on tin verre fixé, ivory (backing), glass, gilt metal

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 1 x 3.7 cm (3/8 x 1 7/16 in.)

value: Gift of R. Keith Kane from the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes

label: Description
value: Circular form with painted scene depicting light skinned woman on left in white, low cut bodice with mid-length, ruffled sleeves, loose white overskirt, longer light blue underskirt, barefeet, white scarf on head, and long, tied black ribbon around her neck. She lifts skirts slightly while gazing at black man to her right; he wears short orange and brown skirt, possibly feathered, with brown strap draped diagonally across his bare chest and tall, orange feathered headdress. His left hand is on his hip while he points downward with his right hand as he gestures to the lighter skinned woman. Behind him to the right are two black women: one wears long orange, white, and black vertically striped skirt, scarf with black and orange stripes, draped head scarf with orange stripes, and gold beaded choker around neck; second woman at extreme right with her back turned to viewer wears long gold, white, and black vertically striped skirt, orange and white scarf draped over shoulders, white blouse with 3/4 length sleeves, tall orange and white turban on her head, and white pendant earrings; both women gaze at the other two figures. Landscape of palms and other plant life in background, as well as indigenous architecture at rear left. Sky painted in pale blue and orange tones. Painting protected by domed glass and framed in gilded metal. Plain metal loop attached to center of reverse side.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint verre fixeé, ivory (backing), glass, gilt metal

label: Description
value: Horizontal landscape panel with lion under trees, horseback riders, pool and fishermen, and so forth. Fruit trees spaced across foreground and architecture in background. Stylized floral border with black outlines on all but top side. Work needlepoint with torches of silk: red, yellow, blue, green, brown, grey, and lavender.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, wool, silk Technique: counted stitch embroidery

label: Description
value: Horizontal cream ribbon connects bunch of pink roses with smaller motifs of two pink rose buds. Ground has staggered rows of striped horizontal figures; printed on graded cream and tan ground. Two identical borders to the width.

label: Description
value: Oval with rose cluster and rose sprays framed in approximately horizontal rectangle with scroll outline is major motif. This repeats horizontally with vertical scroll motif intervening. To be cut along center. Printed in eight colors on pale blue ground.

label: Description
value: Bold leafy scrolls with small pink roses alternate in checkered fashion with delicate ropes of small flowers forming eight-pointed star centered with small flower and bud. Printed on pink ground.

label: Description
value: A series of approximately circular figures, the largest of which has scrolled frame with red center motifs. Printed in gold, white and red on dull yellow embossed ground.

label: Description
value: Graded vertical lines spaced with vertical dotted bands. The latter are broken at intervals by motif of simple pink rose surrounded by green leaves and pin dot decoration. Roses are in drop repeating relationship. Drop match. Printed in five colors and gold on neutral ground.

label: Description
value: Drop-repeating design of rococo enframement or cartouche containing floral spray. The ground is sown with gold fleur-de-lis. Printed in colors and gold on dark blue embossed ground.

label: Provenance
value: Used in a bedroom in the home of A.E. Coleman, Norman, Oklahoma.

label: Description
value: Rows of drop-repeating conventionalized flower forms surrounded by acanthus leaves with geometric stem; printed in light brown on brown ground.

label: Provenance
value: Used in upstairs hall in house in Morman, Oklahoma. Town founded in 1889 asland grant.

label: Description
value: Diagonal rows of scroll-enframed figures of various shapes. A near geometrical feeling results. Figures are not large. The most elaborate motif has leafy forms in pink and silver.

label: Description
value: Twisting acanthus octagonal framework centered with leafy forms interlock in all-over pattern. Printed on light tan ground.

label: Description
value: Tan colored ingrain paper with no printed design, contains many grayish fibers.

label: Provenance
value: Used in the house of Mr. and Mrs. A.E. Coleman, 315 East Symones, Norman, Oklahoma. House built in 1889 when town was founded as land grant.

label: Description
value: Drop repeating design. Gold flower and scroll medallion enclosing red field with black stylized sprigs. Foliate scrolls connect the repeating medallions. The seeming, not actual, ground is dull green. Sown with paler green sprigs.

label: Description
value: Large bunches of pink carnations repeat horizontally above a continuous wave. Design richly laid with gold leaf. Floral bands at bottom. Graded cream and brown ground. Gold leaf.

label: Provenance
value: Used in upper hall of Coleman House, Norman, Oklahoma, above 1949-97-2.

label: Description
value: Fine network formed by delicate geometrical scrolls embellished with small floral ropes and flower clusters. Printed in gold, silver, pink, green, white on pale blue ground.

label: Description
value: Between silvered vertical bands are drop repeating cartouches containing small clusters of flowers enframed with gold scrollwork and smaller clusters of flowers.

label: Description
value: Square panel of white cotton, drawn and worked over into a net-like background for an almost solid embroidery in silk of highly conventionalized geometric and flower forms. Pale blue, green, peach color, grey, white and black for outlines. Faced with striped blue and white silk. Backed by yellow cotton block-printed in flower spray of red and green.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and cotton Technique: embroidery

label: Description
value: Addorsed and facing pairs of peacocks with chrystanthemums.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 27.9 x 26.7 cm (11 in. x 10 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Repeats of a floral design in tan on blue background. Border with flowers and animals in multicolored silk. Lined in red wool.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic threads Technique: plain compound weave

label: Description
value: Narrow band showing repeating pattern of flowers and birds.

label: Description
value: Foliate design in art nouveau style. Large green leaves, on brownish yellow ground. At the center of the major motif are three stylized blossoms in brownish yellow. Drop match.

label: Description
value: Table mat edged at either side with a wide border showing peacocks.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: withdrawn element work

label: Description
value: Panel edged on one side with a wide border in a design showing a conventionalized vine pattern. Trimmed with bobbin lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: withdrawn element work; bobbin lace

label: Description
value: Panel edged on one side with a border showing a design of birds and flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: withdrawn element work

label: Description
value: Round cap crown and ties in black net embroidered with straw. Crown never mounted.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, straw Technique: satin and running stitches on net

label: Description
value: Shaped head scarf in black Chantilly lace showing pattern of garlands of floral sprays. Scarf outlined along edges by border motif of straight lines and repeated floral spray.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: bobbin lace, Chantilly style

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 22.5 x 160 cm (8 7/8 in. x 5 ft. 3 in.)

label: Description
value: Within an arched niche are St. Martin and the Beggar. At base are strapwork, pendants, masks, grotesques, and seven figures symbolizing the three ecclesiastical and four cardinal virtues: Faith, Hope, and Charity; Temperance, Prudence, Justice, and Fortitude. All decorations in relief.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Jacques Séligmann

label: Description
value: An ovoid-shaped vessel, probably a flask of some sort, with a small opening at the top.  The upper portion has bands of carving with figure and animal motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on paperboard
Ewer of Solid Silver made at Ispahan

label: Description
value: A ewer seen from the side.  The entire surface is covered with bands of floral ornament.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on paperboard

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink on illustration board

label: Description
value: Illustration of an angel fish, facing left, seen in profile.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and grey and black watercolor, white gouache on paper

label: Description
value: Woman's white cotton chyrpy embroidered with silk and wool felt appliqué in red, green, yellow, blue and magenta. Vertical stalks of highly stylized tulips rise from the hem, and a wide solidly-worked geometric border forms the collar and comes about half-way down the front. False sleeves fall down the back, and are joined at the wrist by a band of red cloth embroidered in black and white. The garment is lined in part with coarse white cotton cloth and is hand-sewn throughout; the lower edge has been cut.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery, wool appliqué, cotton foundation Technique: embroidered and appliquéd on plain weave foundation Label: cotton, appliquéd with wool and embroidered with silk
